basics.name: Jerome Yang
basics.label: Software Engineer - User Interface, Data Visualization
basics.summary:
I am a front-end software developer with 4+ years of solid professional experience in web UI/UX, geospatial technologies and data visualization.

Primary skills:
- Web development with JavaScript (Angular.js, jQuery, Bootstrap, d3.js), HTML and CSS
- REST API development with SQL and Java or Python
- Mobile development for Android and iOS
- Big data analysis with Hadoop, PySpark, etc

Areas of interest:
- Data analysis and visualization
- Geospatial technologies and maps
- Technical writing and communication
- Agile methodologies and product management

Please contact me if you'd like to talk about any of the above!

work.summary:
 I'm a primary developer of Pointillist, a web-based business intelligence tool that enables marketers to discover opportunities through their customers' behavior patterns. Along with my co-workers, I created a large-scale Angular- and d3-based graphic interface from scratch. This interface allows users to interact with their data as if they're playing games, and to see aesthetic visualizations immediately.
 As one of the founding engineer of this product, I also extensively involve in product design, technical research and cross-team communication.

 Designed UI/UX for ArcGIS.com map viewer: conceptualization and front-end prototyping in a design team.
 Developed web applications with D3.js, jQuery, Dojo and other JavaScript libraries.
 Evangelized JavaScript API products with technical writing and presentation.
 Processed and analyzed big data (enterprise server logs) with Python to provide future software development strategies.
 Contributed JavaScript and Python code to API libraries and ArcGIS.com data portal.

 Automated software development workflow and documentation generation with Python.
 Tested ArcGIS API for JavaScript v3.0 and ArcGIS.com.
 Prototyped and documented JavaScript applications for ArcGIS users.

 Visualized world demographic and religious data on the WorldMap web mapping platform.
 Automated the process of parsing and integrating data from multiple sources using Python script.
 Assisted Harvard faculty to leverage web GIS technology for academic research.

• Used Trimble GeoExplorer 2008 and ArcPad 10.0 to locate and visit over 500 off-shore sites along a 100-mile coast segment of Maine to validate the accuracy of eelgrass maps (ground truth work).
• Developed an API-based web map application for the Maine Marine Patrol officers to report the locations of young eel harvesting activities online.
• Managed large amount of spatial data of the government (listing, comparing, and editing ShapeFile; duplicated removal) among multiple File Geodatabase (FGDB) and ArcSDE data servers using Python script.

• Visualized statistics (US Census and American Community Survey) and established spatial database for study area.
• Integrated GPS tracker, Garmin application, and Google Earth to provide dynamic map for field investigation.
• Worked on an environmental health study with the research team.

• Provided technical support (desktop, printer, and GIS software) for 40 master's students.
• Collected and updated the information of GIS conferences, jobs, and resources; sustained a GIS resource website.
• Managed public affairs and maintained lab equipment for students.

• Illustrated and edited maps for an annual map calendar (print volume: 3,000) to promote geographical education.
• Joined social statistics to shapefiles and displayed data on maps for conference posters and a textbook by ArcGIS 9.2 and Adobe Illustrator CS3.
• Provided technical supports for ArcGIS 9.2 and Adobe Illustrator CS3 to research assistants.
